intro: Astragalus scalaris, commonly known as the scalycup milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators. Astragalus scalaris is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
